segment.source: What's new in Credential Guard (Windows 10)
segment.target: What's new in Credential Guard (Windows 10)

segment.source: Credential Guard uses virtualization-based security to isolate secrets so that only privileged system software can access them.
segment.target: Credential Guard uses virtualization-based security to isolate secrets so that only privileged system software can access them.

segment.source: What's new in Credential Guard?
segment.target: What's new in Credential Guard?

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Credential Guard uses virtualization-based security to isolate secrets so that only privileged system software can access them.
segment.target: Credential Guard uses virtualization-based security to isolate secrets so that only privileged system software can access them.

segment.source: New features in Windows 10, version 1511
segment.target: New features in Windows 10, version 1511

segment.source: Credential Manager support.
segment.target: Credential Manager support.

segment.source: Credentials that are stored with Credential Manager, including domain credentials, are protected with Credential Guard with the following considerations:
segment.target: Credentials that are stored with Credential Manager, including domain credentials, are protected with Credential Guard with the following considerations:

segment.source: Credentials that are saved by the Remote Desktop Protocol cannot be used.
segment.target: Credentials that are saved by the Remote Desktop Protocol cannot be used.

segment.source: Employees in your organization can manually store credentials in Credential Manager as generic credentials.
segment.target: Employees in your organization can manually store credentials in Credential Manager as generic credentials.

segment.source: Applications that extract derived domain credentials using undocumented APIs from Credential Manager will no longer be able to use those saved derived credentials.
segment.target: Applications that extract derived domain credentials using undocumented APIs from Credential Manager will no longer be able to use those saved derived credentials.

segment.source: You cannot restore credentials using the Credential Manager control panel if the credentials were backed up from a PC that has Credential Guard turned on.
segment.target: You cannot restore credentials using the Credential Manager control panel if the credentials were backed up from a PC that has Credential Guard turned on.

segment.source: If you need to back up your credentials, you must do this before you enable Credential Guard.
segment.target: If you need to back up your credentials, you must do this before you enable Credential Guard.

segment.source: Otherwise, you won't be able to restore those credentials.
segment.target: Otherwise, you won't be able to restore those credentials.

segment.source: Enable Credential Guard without UEFI lock.
segment.target: Enable Credential Guard without UEFI lock.

segment.source: You can enable Credential Guard by using the registry.
segment.target: You can enable Credential Guard by using the registry.

segment.source: This allows you to disable Credential Guard remotely.
segment.target: This allows you to disable Credential Guard remotely.

segment.source: However, we recommend that Credential Guard is enabled with UEFI lock.
segment.target: However, we recommend that Credential Guard is enabled with UEFI lock.

segment.source: You can configure this by using Group Policy.
segment.target: You can configure this by using Group Policy.

segment.source: CredSSP/TsPkg credential delegation.
segment.target: CredSSP/TsPkg credential delegation.

segment.source: CredSSP/TsPkg cannot delegate default credentials when Credential Guard is enabled.
segment.target: CredSSP/TsPkg cannot delegate default credentials when Credential Guard is enabled.

segment.source: Learn how to deploy and manage Credential Guard within your organization.
segment.target: Learn how to deploy and manage Credential Guard within your organization.
